The game I've been working on for about two and a half years has a problem I am unable to figure out. I am hoping someone will be able to help me resolve it, so that I don't have to scrap it.
In the game interface I selected, Picture Frame: A static picture that appears above text.
For the most part it works quite well. When I play through the game it seems to work just fine. Yet, when others test the game...I think they click the directional, move buttons too quickly or something...not sure. But after awhile, the text slips up behind the static picture. Sure you can scroll the text back down. But at that point, unless the player manually scrolls after every move, they are bound to miss something.
I might also mention I have it set the clear previous turns, so that the text doesn't build up.
The static pictures in my game are very important to the game play. So, I can not just do without them.
Any ideas on why it works great for the most part and suddenly starts doing this, would be helpful.
Thanks in advance...
